meanings.definition: To make a sudden or forceful movement upward or forward.
meanings.sent1: The frog umped out of the pond.
meanings.sent2: She umped over the hurdle with ease.
meanings.sent3: The balloon umped into the sky, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His heart umped with excitement as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The rocket umped into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: To act as an umpire in a game or match.
meanings.sent1: He umped the baseball game last night.
meanings.sent2: The referee umped the soccer match fairly.
meanings.sent3: The cat umped the chess game, but nobody took it seriously.
meanings.sent4: She umped the debate, making sure both sides were heard.
meanings.sent5: The judge umped the talent show, deciding the winner.
